intro: Pinus gerardii, commonly known as the African silver fir, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright trunk and its distinctive, needle-like leaves that are typically 4–6 cm long. The tree produces cones that are initially yellow and later turn brown, containing seeds that are dispersed by wind. Pinus gerardii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems in its native range.
